subsection.name: Overview
subsection.p: The plugin registers the "eclipse" target and enables you to issue ant eclipse. The generated files establish an Eclipse project that contains the definitions for the index.xml file in scope (the current directory or the first parent dir with an index.xml by default). All resources of type .jar are added to the Eclipse project with their local path, down from the Eclipse MAGIC_CACHE variable that points out the location of ${dpml.cache} (has to be defined manually in Eclipse).
Generated files/dirs: Project description - target/eclipse/.project (should be copied into current dir) - target/eclipse/.classpath (should be copied into current dir)

subsection.name: Example
subsection.source:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<project name="demo" default="default" basedir="." xmlns:transit="antlib:net.dpml.transit" >
<property file="build.properties" /> <transit:import uri="local:template:magic/reactor"/>
<transit:import uri="local:template:magic/eclipse"/>
</project>

subsection.name: Properties
subsection.p: The following optional properties may be used to override default behaviour.

tr.td: the URI for the .project template file
the URI for the .classpath template file
name of the generated eclipse project
which project keys the task should look for dependent resources
if true the eclipse task will not be executed

subsection.p: The file at the project.eclipse.project.uri location can contain ant filter token @PROJECT_NAME@.
